item.description:
Gallery Night Providence -- Hop on the Bus

Gallery Night Providence has returned for the season. It's completely free. On the third Thursday of the month, from March through November, twenty-one of the city’s hot “art spots” open their doors for a visual arts party. You can park in one of their designated lots -- it's free for Gallery Night -- and then a bus takes you to different art galleries around Providence. There are also walking tours, but they start earlier in the evening. This is such a great way to experience all types of art!

They have a new information center at Regency Plaza downtown, diagonally behind the Providence Public Library and near the Dunkin Donuts Center. Claire will meet everyone inside the Information Center at Regency Plaza at 6:30 p.m. The buses run every 25 minutes, so we'll catch the next bus. Gallery Night runs until 9 p.m.

Afterward, we can go to Bravo Brasserie for dinner/appetizers/drinks. It's a French restaurant, moderately priced, with great food. Especially the fries.

I am hoping to do this every month, depending on how it turns out.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet inside the information center -- look for Claire
item.name: Gallery Night - Providence
